result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee R. Ratcliff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes:
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Lee R. Ratcliff appeared, pro se  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Pre-trial conference at 12-01-2015 09:30 am.
Status conference at 12-17-2015 09:10 am.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Lee R. Ratcliff appeared, pro se.    Defendant was advised of right to attorney and waived that right  at this time.  Victim is present and asks for no contact to be dropped, Court modified bond to no contact with victim not have any violent or otherwise disorderly conduct.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:10 am.

Status conference at 11-17-2015 10:30 am.
Bail/Bond Review at 11-17-2015 10:30 am.
Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation
Copy of letter from Victim/Witness Coordinator to the defendant indicating the victim wishes the no contact dropped(with copy of victims request)
THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY

ADDRESS INFO for Lee R. Ratcliff
Current: PO Box 31, 115 N First St Apt 1, Abbotsford, WI 54405   (Effective: 10-09-2015)
Prior: 115 N First St, Apt 1, Abbotsford, WI 54405

The defendant shall have no contact with T.W. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Retrieval  of personal property, including the dog, through a third party is allowed. 
AMENDED 11-17-15 Court modified bond allowing contact with the victim but is  not allowed to have any violent or otherwise disorderly conduct with the victim.

ADDRESS INFO for Lee R. Ratcliff
Current: 115 N First St, Apt 1, Abbotsford, WI 54405   (Effective: 10-09-2015)
Prior: 115 N Fifth St, Apt 1, Abbotsford, WI 54405

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:15 am.
